content: //www tiktok com/t/ztl8wmaem/ but make sure you are maintaining 42 stitches when you use it finish off usually means to chain 1 and pull a tail though if you are working a circle you can slip_stitch in the next stitch and then chain 1 and pull through the tail to make the circle more even i never measure my long tails but i would guess about ~7 inches this pokeball is a bit bigger than my other patterns in order to fit the larger pokemon start with red yarn this is because you can make a prettier center with a magic_ring than you can when finishing and closing a ball make a magic_ring or your preferred method for starting a round round 1 6 single_crochet magic_ring with 6 single_crochet round 2 increase x 6 12 round 3 single_crochet increase x 6 18 round 4 2 single_crochet increase x 6 24 round 5 3 single_crochet increase x 6 30 round 6 4 single_crochet increase x 6 36 round 7 5 single_crochet increase x 6 42 rounds 8 - 12 42 single_crochet round 13 change to black yarn 6 single_crochet use 4 00mm/us g/6 hook to make 31 chain note this is one more than you technically need doing so makes the next round easier return to using 3 25mm us d/3 to make 6 single_crochet the first of these 6 is in the 31th stitch from the last worked stitch 6 single_crochet pokeball to dragonite reversible pattern by the nerd gremlin round 14 change to white yarn 6 single_crochet work in the bottom bumps of the chain stitches 30 single_crochet 6 single_crochet count your stitches before continuing to the next round you should have 42 round 15 - 18 42 single_crochet round 19 5 single_crochet decrease x 6 36 round 20 4 single_crochet decrease x 6 30 round 21 3 single_crochet decrease x 6 24 round 22 2 single_crochet decrease x 6 18 round 23 single_crochet decrease x 6 12 round 24 decrease x 6 6 finish off and leave a long tail for sewing round 25 sew opening closed by threading tapestry needle though all 6 single_crochet outer legs hide the tail in some stitches and leave the rest of the tail in the pokeball pokemon button round 1 magic_ring with 8 single_crochet close ring with black yarn with slip_stitch round 2 increase x 6 16 finish off and leave a long tail for sewing the button to pokeball sew button to pokeball top red at the center front count 15 stitches from the edge center the button vertically it s center should be at the edge of the red pokeball opening an easy mistake and somewhat unavoidable issue is putting the button too high such that it s not centered when the pokeball is closed sew the top ~6 single_crochet or less to pokeball threading tapestry needle around two legs of the button and through the pokeball stitches then secure the back middle of the button to the pokeball
